SUMMARY: REQUIRED | OPTIONAL DETAIL: ELEMENT

com.centimia.orm.jaqu.annotation
Annotation Type Inherited

@Retention(value=RUNTIME)
@Target(value=TYPE)
public @interface Inherited

Only supports single table for class hierarchy with a DiscriminatorColumn and a DiscriminatorValue. This strategy, though not the only possible strategy, is the most performent strategy in a relational DB as it requires no joins or unions, and it allows for AUTO incrementors like IDENTITY and SEQUENCE. Because of the unique way Jaqu works with queries DBs, if you have an existing DB and you need to reflect these tables in objects you have the option of declaring an object for each table and using a join query (These tables do not need to be entities but they can if you also want to maintain relationship). A more complex option is to declare a third object which is a combination of the two and again map it using a join) The strategy used here manes that there is a super class, which has no Entity mapping, i.e. it's a mapped supper class which is announced by the inherited child using extends. Mapping of the super class fields should be done on the super class. These mappings will only be checked if the super class will have a @MappedSuperclass annotation. This is because the hierarchy could be deeper then one parent and not all parents are always mapped.

Author:
Shai Bentin

Optional Element Summary
 java.lang.String DiscriminatorColumn
          the column in the DB holding the discriminator.
 char DiscriminatorValue
          the discriminator word to be used in the discriminator column to distinguish one object child from another.
 InheritedType inheritedType
          Determines how the inheritance is mapped to the persistence store.
 

inheritedType

public abstract InheritedType inheritedType
Determines how the inheritance is mapped to the persistence store. In both cases there is a single table. One with Discriminator the other assumes only a single object is mapped per table (TABLE_PER_CLASS)

Default:
com.centimia.orm.jaqu.InheritedType.TABLE_PER_CLASS

DiscriminatorColumn

public abstract java.lang.String DiscriminatorColumn
the column in the DB holding the discriminator. The default is 'class'. If this column does not exist it will be created

Default:
"class"

DiscriminatorValue

public abstract char DiscriminatorValue
the discriminator word to be used in the discriminator column to distinguish one object child from another.

Default:
32
